events.title: First Email Sent
events.description: Ray Tomlinson, a computer engineer, sent the first email over a network. He is also credited with introducing the use of the '@' symbol in email addresses.

events.title: Introduction of the Floppy Disk
events.description: IBM introduced the 8-inch floppy disk, a portable storage medium that would become widely used for data storage and transfer.

events.title: Intel Releases the 4004 Microprocessor
events.description: Intel released the 4004 microprocessor, the first commercially available microprocessor, marking a significant milestone in computing technology.

events.title: Creation of the First Computer Virus
events.description: The Creeper virus, considered the first computer virus, was created by Bob Thomas at BBN. It infected DEC PDP-10 computers running the TENEX operating system.
